                                            ntrees =  100,
                                            seed   =    1,
                                            max_depth = 5)

# H2O.ai Gradient boosting regression
In this notebook we shall be using the Gradient boosting estimator ([`H2OGradientBoostingEstimator`](https://docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-docs/data-science/gbm.html)) from [H2O.ai](https://www.h2o.ai/) to predict [house prices](https://www.kaggle.com/c/house-prices-advanced-regression-techniques) using the regression technique.

To learn more about H2O.ai see:
* [H2O.ai Overview](https://docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-docs/index.html)
* [H2O.ai Tutorials](https://docs.h2o.ai/h2o-tutorials/latest-stable/index.html)

Firstly, import `h2o` and start a local H2O server
source.4df18352: Read in the data as a [H2OFrame](https://docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-py/docs/frame.html), the primary data store for H2O. For examples of munging with H2O see the [Data Manipulation](https://docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-docs/data-munging.html) page.
source.26f89d83: we shall now [combine](https://docs.h2o.ai/h2o/latest-stable/h2o-docs/data-munging/combining-columns.html) our predictions with the `test_data`
